item.title: Getting Started
item.description:
This post will guide you in setting up your very own Hugo site with this theme. It covers the essential parts: installation, basic usage and recommended next steps. After setting up the basics, feel free to also take a look at other posts!

Installation

This guide is a shorter version of Hugo’s quick start (you may even say it’s a quicker start). If you face any problems or want more comprehensive content, make sure to check it out!

item.title: Configuration
item.description:
This page outlines the configuration options for the theme. There are plenty of settings for tweaking your site’s layout and content presentation. Key features include options for controlling the side pane visibility, adjusting the number of items displayed on each list page, and managing elements such as featured posts, recent posts, taxonomies, and related content.

Global Config

The following configuration options can be added to your site’s Hugo config file.

item.title: Le design centré utilisateur
item.description: Le design centré utilisateur est un des concepts que j’ai approfondis dans ma veille UX, car il relie directement ce que j’aime faire (comprendre les gens et concevoir des interfaces) à la manière dont les meilleurs produits numériques sont construits aujourd’hui. L’article de Maze explique très bien en quoi cette approche, appelée User‑Centered Design (UCD), n’est pas seulement une méthode, mais une véritable philosophie : à chaque décision de design, on commence par les besoins, attentes et problèmes de l’utilisateur final, puis on vérifie en continu que le produit y répond vraiment.

item.title: Les interfaces dans le gaming
item.description:
Je m’intéresse pas mal à l’UX/UI mais je suis aussi un grand joueur de jeux vidéo, je m’intéresse de plus en plus aux évolutions qui rendent les interfaces plus fluides et immersives car tout au long de mon expérience une bonne interface fais vraiment la différence dans un jeu. Je vous partage ici mes découvertes dans ce domaine.

Interfaces minimalistes, impact maximal

Les menus surchargés et HUD encombrés appartiennent au passé. Les studios optent désormais pour des designs épurés qui ne présentent que l’essentiel au bon moment comme dans “Elden Ring” ou “Ghost of Tsushima”. Cette approche réduit drastiquement la charge cognitive et permet aux joueurs de rester pleinement concentrés sur l’action. Le flat design moderne, associé à des animations simple et une iconographie immédiatement compréhensible, crée des expériences fluide. Pour un designer de jeux, cela impose de répondre à une question fondamentale pour chaque écran : quelles sont les trois informations absolument prioritaires et comment les rendre lisibles en un clin d’œil, même en plein combat ?

item.title: Les technologies émergentes
item.description:
En 2025, les technologies émergentes amènent l’UX/UI vers des expériences plus contextuelles et intelligentes. La réalité augmentée et l’UX prédictif obligent à penser des systèmes d’interaction à la place de simples écrans.

Réalité augmentée : l’interface dans l’espace

La réalité augmentée ne se limite plus au e‑commerce : elle enrichit désormais des lieux culturels, éducatifs ou médicaux. Dans une visite comme celle du Mémorial de Waterloo, les utilisateurs superposent les scènes historiques, les flèches de navigation et annotations à l’environnement réel, ce qui transforme la visite en une histoire interactif tout en ajoutant contraste, taille de texte et audiodescription pour rester accessible aux publics malvoyants.

item.title: About
item.description:
About

Hugo is one of the most popular open-source static site generators. With its amazing speed and flexibility, Hugo makes building websites fun again.

Rusty-Typewriter is a theme for Hugo sites made by math-queiroz. It’s intended to be simple and used for blogs, being mostly inspired by the current Zen Browser’s website in style and other Hugo themes in functionality. It was initially intended for personal use but was made public for anyone who finds it worth using.

item.title: Dark Theme
item.description:
You can change the current theme between dark and light mode by using the switcher icon at the right of the navbar.

The colors tweaked by the theme change are ideally defined in a non bundled CSS file (to optimize caching, since the theming is expected to change more than the rest) under the :root[color-scheme^='dark/light'] selector. Should you want to adjust them, a simple stylesheet rules override should suffice. You can read about it in customization.

item.title: Internationalization
item.description:
Rusty Typewriter supports internationalization (i18n) files for localizing its sentences. By default it fallsback to english, but you may use the values from an existing translations file or add your own translations in the i18n/<lang>.yaml dir of your site.

# Root
theme_light: Light Theme
theme_dark: Dark Theme

# Footer
scroll_top: Scroll to Top
footer: Made with ❤️ and powered by {{ .ThemeAnchor }} theme for {{ .HugoAnchor }}

# Home
featured_posts: Featured Posts
recent_posts: Recent Posts

# SidePane for home
search: Search...
see_all: See all...

# Page
breadcrumb_home: Home

# SidePane for single pages
details_words: words
details_read_time: minutes read
side_table_of_contents: Table Of Contents
side_attachments: Attachments
side_related: Related

Note: Didn’t find a value you’re looking for? Check the repository for the given file (which may be updated with it), or create a new feature request!

item.title: Search
item.description:
Search

Here you can search for indexable pages, like posts and alike. There’s also support for URL param “q” which then auto searches upon page load event.

It's necessary to enable Javascript

Loading...

item.title: Showcase
item.description:
This page focuses on what you can do in terms of markdown syntax. Here you can see which and how each of the components are rendered to HTML in terms of structure and styling.

The use of Headings

Headings are larger text intended for section titles, and they vary in size from 1 to 5 (bigger to smaller) as follows:

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

Heading 4

Heading 5

Paragraphs

Paragraphs are containers for standard page content. Its font is defined and configurable via CSS as mentioned in customization post.

item.title: Static Content
item.description:
Some of the static content on the site, like the home greetings and side pane content, can be defined in the file at data/rtwt/content.yaml. The structure to do so is as follows:

Note: It’s possible to use file formats other than YAML, but the key structure must remain the same!

home:
 image: 'images/greetings.jpg'
 greetings: 'A Hugo Theme for Bloggers!'
 text: 'The definitive, configurable, customizable, old fashioned rusty coloured theme for web writers and readers.'
side:
 home:
 - content: 'Oh, and did I mention it has support for static side pane content? Cool, right?'
 - title: 'Media Support'
 content: 'Side content can have images!'
 imagePath: 'images/hugo.svg'
 imageHref: 'https://gohugo.io'
 imageWidth: '100%'

Didn’t find a value you’re looking for? Check the repository for the given file (which may be updated with it), or create a new feature request!

item.title: Taxonomies Support
item.description:
The main taxonomy in the theme is tags, as it is the one listed under the title in every “single” page, but it’s also possible to set any number of arbitrary taxonomies which will be listed in the side pane details section.

For example, in this site there’s the taxonomies topic and series as defined in the config file.

[taxonomies]
 tag = 'tags'
 topic = 'topics'
 series = 'series'
